body_content.explanation: any of various plants of a genus (= group) of tropical American evergreen plants (= ones that never lose their leaves), often grown in containers inside a house because of their attractive leaves, although they are poisonous:
examples: Dieffenbachia is as common a pot plant in this country as in Western Australia.
We recommend caution when presented with a patient exposed to Dieffenbachia.
He experimented in the parks, using not just cannas and coleus, but dieffenbachias and even bananas.
